column4: i was wondering if someone could help me.  basically my roommate downloaded some kbuntu app and in the process of trying to remove managed to render my computer unbootbale in ANY form, including cd
that is not good,  you need tofigure out if the hardware is damaged in some way, do you get as far as the bios during the boot sequence ? does the bios recognise the hdd ?
I would say reinstall but if the cd doesn't boot properly this becomes a problem  maybe try the alternate install cd
sorry to hear that,  but that is pretty much all I can do for you
search the forrum for the error msg
stress
consider you might ahve a borked cd-rom
what whit ?
do you get as far as the boot manager ?
i mean the boot menu
I remember from yesterday,
any other os on that computer ?
you mean boot windows or the windows install cd ?
you mean boot windows or the windows install cd ?
laptop or desktop ?
try to borrow a cd-rw from someone and see if it works better
do you have access to another computer ?
no I mean another desktop , I was going to suggest you plug your try out your hdd in it to see if it works
